overview:
Rami Rinot is the Publisher and Executive Editor of CHIC.TV, he published and co-authored The Spirits of Cocktail and The Spirits of New York Restaurant and Lifestyle Guide.

Rami has vast managerial and entrepreneurial experience. Before establishing CHIC.TV, he was Chief Operating Officer of GigaSpaces Technologies, a grid computing software company funded by Intel, BRM Capital and FT Ventures, prior to which he led Gal-On.com Venture Capital, a technology incubator focusing on innovative technology and medical devices. Following GigaSpaces, Rinot served as a V.P. Business Development of IntaMission, a UK based software Integration Company funded by 3i.

Rinot was a member of the Peres Center for Peace and was an escort to Nobel Prize Winner, Archbishop Desmond Tutu, aiding his efforts to promote peace in the Middle East.

Rinot received an honor for outstanding achievement for his service in the IDF as a battalion medic with responsibility for one of the largest military hospitals in Israel.

Rinot has an Executive MBA from Bradford University in England and a Bachelor of Management from Ben-Gurion University in Israel.
